title: Losing faith in Riot
body:
When preseason changes came out, there were a couple of issues that came very clear:

1. The overall damage is far too high
2. The base stats, which cannot be tweaked by runes anymore, are quite low on some aspects (MR!!!!)
3. Towers are fragile as paper (they were weak before)
4. Blue essence system does not provide as much income as the old system, numerous people have proven this already

...and I thought: Okay, no sweat. Riot has balanced out their game pretty well for the last season (yeah, there was always a "meta", but if you were especially fond with a non-meta pick, you could easily play something else). They will address the issues, and over the course of time, fix them.

Now, several hotfixes and a whole patch iteration later, the game is still broken.

1. The damage has not been downtoned despite some "nerfs" (Sona, Aery - at least the first one is really minor).
2. Base stats have not changed yet, you still get bent over by basically every AP champ (different opinion? Let me know).
3. They "buffed" towers - err, no they didn't. They added < 10% to their life, but made them more prone to minion damage.
4. They introduced a tiny BE reward for FWotD - and nerfed XP gain on the other end. I did not make a calculation, but that could very well turn out to be a decrease in BE income instead of an increase.

I know it's still preseason and I hope that Riot will address these things before next year. Otherwise, League will turn into non-strategic three-lane ARAM-style speed game, where one side can basically surrender after 10 minutes and if not, the game is over at 25 minutes average anyways. Slightly exaggerated maybe, but you get the idea.

Related to this, I'd like to have your opinion on the changed playstyle of the game. I am low elo, and yes, feel free to be preoccupied, but recently no one cares too much about non-tower objectives anymore. It's more about gathering as a team, wiping the enemy and instantly get two towers. Turn the gold into an item lead aaaaand repeat - gg. Or am I wrong here?

So we knew runes we're going to shake things up quite a lot. For the last few months, we tried a lot of combos and fixed a lot of things that would be absurd before they released, but we can't catch everything. 

Preseason is going to be broken, it's the time where we try some major changes to the game that we just can't put out at any other time (Can you imagine this going out during midseason, when your climbing? O.o) We can't fix it all in one patch, we need time to figure out what the fix should be and how it will effect everything (Which is why preseason is a few months). Is it that MF is strong with meteor, or is it that other champs/runes in the botlane are weak? Is Aery too reliable or is Comet not reliable enough? Right now there are a million questions, and each answer effects the game in a different way. 

We always fix these things before the season starts, we just need some more time. 

TLDR: Help us find what is busted and we will fix it.

>Ezreal. It's never been in doubt. The problem is that you guys are pussy footing around the issue and refusing to just nerf him. Even the nerf on the PBE (which ought to be hotfixed live ASAP BTW) is a joke that won't fix him.

Ezreal's problems have never been number based. Maybe at the beginning but we've gotten to the point where Ezreal is a flawed design. He breaks something once-a-season and holds back other "on-next-hit" items because there's a chance he could break it. Tweaking numbers doesn't fix a design like this. Case and point: He was meh-to-garbage until preseason came along and the next great abuseable things Ezreal could abuse appears. (And the change to on-hit spells)

I think Ezreal's current power goes further than abusing some rune or item right now.

The new season meta we see a shift away from dps and farming to one of burst and being on the edge of dying constantly. Even if Klepto did not exist Ezreal would still be doing fantastic with Aeri or w/e right now. Threshold to kill is so low.

I feel like my own play benefits from this season. Maybe I play pretty conservatively making sure I get 90+% cs and keep my lane in controlled safe places until I slowly whittle my opponent down that they become a non threat and become a tipping point themselves when ganks coming. And in this season even playing safely it is SO EASY to blow people up. And I dig it. And Ezreal in a similar vein being a "safe""pokey" wussy champion benefits hugely from this new state of things... Aeri on Ezreal's Q? *shudders*

They also buffed his Q cd and ratio to such levels he became a jungle in the preseason in a feeble attempt to have him compete bot against dps adc. I personally feel it wasn't ultra OP but it was pretty dang good at aggressive ganks and clearing and stuff.

Draven would like to have a word with this analysis. Klepto means very little when your opponent can push waves harder and does more damage while staying hidden behind minions.

Also, if you look at builds outside of Klepto, his winrate drops precipitously. I think his highest winrate without Klepto is ~51%? I’m not saying Ez + Klepto isn’t broken. It is. The amount of gold efficiency and utility you get from the mastery is insane and needs to be brought in line. But considering that Ez was not a problem before this massive shift in game mechanics, it frankly makes more sense to look at said mechanic he’s breaking rather than the champ himself.

Also, yes, I ultimately do think Ezreal needs some sort of rework. It’s a long time coming honestly.

Trouble is, I have a feeling that he'll be back in the dumpster after that again, as I'm sure they'll then ALSO nerf Klepto, leaving him once again outscaled and outlaned by other ADCs.

If they're going to un-buff his mystic shot, they should give him some power elsewhere in his kit.  Maybe un-nerf his ulti CD?

Maybe they can make it not proc on his q? That could probably make it less OP.

When I saw Ez jungle I got really scared of playing against him for a few weeks so I was banning him rather constantly. However  I am also scared of more common picks ever since the new runes I've been risking not banning him for other potential scary threats in bot lane.

Ez also is the type of champion I found that bounced around from bad to op due to game changes and such, he is such a scary champ to main I wouldnt be able to do it myself.

Every time I look at Ez on paper ability wise I dont understand why he is so OP, broken and scary. It's not like his abilities are ridiculous (Example zoe one shotting with q or being able to steal summoner spells or block projectiles like yas etc)

I personally love klepto, it really helps me as a support with money, mana, and catching up etc. Maybe Ezreal needs a change or maybe klepto needs it.. however it is going to sadden me greatly when I can no longer get bags of money, mana pots, and skill elixars to help me out when I am behind. xD
Ezreal's kit is fine.. If his design was that conflicting, riot wouldn't be releasing champions like Zoe and Kalista.

They didn't really buff mages. You lose out on all flat pen from runes and masteries. The difference is that you are even more forced into building pen since sorcs got buffed, and flat pen is stronger vs low mr targets. I would almost say midlane mages got one of the hardest hits by the base stat change: they have 19 armor at level one. AD assassins can still get pen through sudden impact. So basically, Talon 100-0 you at level 2 if he hits his combo, and Zed oneshots you hitting half his abilities if you don't build armor.

However AP champs botlane deal massive damage now. They get the same adaptive stats as mages, and spell thiefs got buffed. This means their damage is the same or higher than midlaners early. When they don't need to spend any mana farming, that is truly a lot of pressure. 

I agree with the other problems. In my opinion there should not be so much targeted damage in a squishy meta. Duskblade and Statikk+rapidfire combo are mistakes by riot in my opinion. Assassins should rely a bit on hitting skillshots so there is actual counterplay when they are fed. You can dodge(flash) or zhonia skillshots. However you cannot do that vs duskblade+electrocute procs that is now a large part of their damage. ADCs also have way too much burst compared to dps- with a good amount of items they should shred tanks and squishies, but they should not outburst mages and some assassins.

I wish Riot didn't try to create a fast-paced, snowbally meta. This only makes games into clownfiestas where the most fed members of teams run around and oneshot everyone with no counterplay. Turrets are basically useless. Their value is larger for the enemy team since they give a lot of gold and deny cs, while only giving minor protection to your team.
